channel.description: Recent content in mutation on AN LAB

item.title: Effects of RT and PCR on mutation spectra
item.description: This is one of those "i-write-it-for-myself" notes about a paper that I really needed to understand This is summary of paper by Orton et al. 2015 “Distinguishing low frequency mutations from RT-PCR and sequence errors in viral deep sequencing data” In this manuscript the authors investigated the effects of various stages of sample preparation on the frequency of artifactual mutations. This is particularly interesting because it is based on re-sequencing on a single stranded RNA virus - a procedure that necessarily involves the Reverse Transcription (RT) step.
